name: Glacier National Park
description: A showcase of melting glaciers, alpine meadows, carved valleys, and spectacular lakes. With over 700 miles of trails, Glacier is a paradise for adventurous visitors seeking a landscape steeped in human culture. Relive the days of old through historic chalets, lodges, and the famous Going-to-the-Sun Road.
shortDescription: A showcase of melting glaciers, alpine meadows, carved valleys, and spectacular lakes. With over 700 miles of trails, Glacier is a paradise for adventurous visitors seeking a landscape steeped in huma...

operatingHours.description: Glacier National Park is open 24 hours a day 365 days of the year. An entrance fee is required, even when entrance stations are not staffed. Instructions are available at each entrance for self-payment.

fees.title: Entrance - Private Vehicle
fees.description:
(Winter Rate - $25.00, November 1 to April 30)
This is an entrance fee for all persons traveling in a single, private, non-commercial vehicle (car/truck/van). The pass is good for seven days and is non-transferable. Visitors can enter the park at any time, if the entrance station is not staffed, a self-registration area is available for purchasing a 7-day park pass.

fees.title: Entrance - Per Person
fees.description:
(Winter Rate - $15.00, November 1 to April 30)
This is a per person entrance fee for a visitor traveling on foot, bicycle, or for individuals traveling together in a vehicle as a non-commercial, organized group. The pass is good for seven days and is non-transferable.

fees.title: Entrance - Motorcycle
fees.description:
(Winter Rate - $20.00, November 1 to April 30)
Valid for 7 days. Admits up to 2 private, non-commercial motorcycles with up to 4 total passengers.

fees.title: Commercial Entrance - Sedan
fees.description: Entrance fees are based on the seating capacity of the vehicle (driver not included). Commercial Sedan entrance fee is $25, plus $20 per person, 16 years of age or older. The pass is good for seven days and is non-transferable.

fees.title: Commercial Entrance - Van
fees.description: Entrance fees are based on the seating capacity of the vehicle (driver not included). Commercial Van entrance fee is $75 regardless of occupancy. The pass is good for seven days and is non-transferable.

fees.title: Commercial Entrance - Mini-bus
fees.description: Entrance fees are based on the seating capacity of the vehicle (driver not included). Commercial Mini-bus entrance fee is $100 regardless of occupancy. The pass is good for seven days and is non-transferable.

fees.title: Commercial Entrance - Motor Coach
fees.description: Entrance fees are based on the seating capacity of the vehicle (driver not included). Commercial Motor Coach fee is $200 regardless of occupancy. The pass is good for seven days and is non-transferable.

fees.title: Nonresident
fees.description: Each non-US resident aged 16 and older visiting Glacier National Park must pay a $100 nonresident fee (in addition to the standard entrance fee), unless admitted with an Annual or America the Beautiful Pass. This includes nonresidents entering as part of a commercial tour group, commercial use authorization (CUA) group, or concessioner tour group.

climate.weatherDescription: Glacier's weather is highly variable and can be extreme. Expect warm, sunny summer days but be ready for any type of conditions. In the winter, temperatures can fall well below freezing and typically the park receives considerable amounts of snow. Glacier's geography, straddling the Continental Divide, sets the stage for clashes of two very different climates. Warm, wet Pacific air moves in from the west, and cold, dry Arctic air flows from the northeast. They meet at the Divide.

images.title: Glacier Lilies near Logan Pass
images.altText: Large mountains dotted with snow loom above a rocky meadow filled with yellow flowers.
images.caption: Glacier lilies dot the landscape off the Highline Trail.

images.title: St. Mary Falls
images.altText: A double waterfall blurs over layered rocks.
images.caption: Glacier National Park is sculpted by water.

images.title: Lobby of the Lake McDonald Lodge
images.altText: Looking down into the lobby of the Lake McDonald Lodge from the balcony
images.caption: Lobby of the historic Lake McDonald Lodge

images.title: Alpine Sunset
images.altText: Clouds of orange and red sit above dark-gray mountains; snow dots the mountain peaks.
images.caption: Majestic Heavens Peak is easily viewed from the Going-to-the-Sun Road.

images.title: Swiftcurrent Fire Lookout
images.altText: A small, brown and white structure sits on a rocky top with mountain peaks in the distance.
images.caption: The historic Swiftcurrent Lookout was built in a Swiss chalet architectural style.

images.title: East Side Sunset
images.altText: Jagged peaks rise out of a forested valley and an empty road curves off into the distance.
images.caption: Going-to-the-Sun Road in the St. Mary Valley

images.title: Glacier's Night Sky
images.altText: Silhouetted mountains and flowers against a night sky filled with stars and a milky band of light.
images.caption: Glacier's dark sky is important to wildlife and people.
